prompt: Set up automated reminders for code review checklist items when I'm working on production code.
baseline_response:
Here's a comprehensive approach to setting up automated reminders for code review checklists:

1. GitHub/GitLab Actions Workflow:
```yaml
name: Code Review Checklist Reminder

on:
  pull_request:
    branches:
      - main
      - develop

jobs:
  checklist-reminder:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Check PR Template
        uses: actions/github-script@v6
        with:
          script: |
            const prBody = context.payload.pull_request.body;
            const checklistItems = [
              '- [ ] Performance considerations checked',
              '- [ ] Security vulnerabilities reviewed',
              '- [ ] Unit tests added/updated',
              '- [ ] Documentation updated',
              '- [ ] Error handling verified',
              '- [ ] Logging implemented',
              '- [ ] Code complexity analyzed'
            ];

            const missingItems = checklistItems.filter(item => 
              !prBody.includes(item.replace('- [ ]', '').trim())
            );

            if (missingItems.length > 0) {
              core.setFailed('Missing checklist items: \n' + missingItems.join('\n'));
            }

      - name: Comment with Reminder
        if: failure()
        uses: actions/github-script@v6
        with:
          github-token: ${{secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN}}
          script: |
            github.rest.issues.createComment({
              issue_number: context.issue.number,
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              body: `🚨 Code Review Checklist Reminder 🚨
              
Please ensure the following checklist items are addressed:
- Performance considerations
- Security vulnerability review
- Unit test coverage
- Documentation updates
- Error handling
- Logging implementation
- Code complexity analysis

Detailed checklist:
\`\`\`
- [ ] Performance considerations checked
- [ ] Security vulnerabilities reviewed
- [ ] Unit tests added/updated
- [ ] Documentation updated
- [ ] Error handling verified
- [ ] Logging implemented
- [ ] Code complexity analyzed
\`\`\`
`
            })
```

2. VS Code Extension (optional):
```json
{
  "name": "code-review-checklist",
  "contributes": {
    "commands": [
      {
        "command": "codeReview.showChecklist",
        "title": "Show Code Review Checklist"
      }
    ],
    "configuration": {
      "title": "Code Review Checklist",
      "properties": {
        "codeReview.checklistItems": {
          "type": "array",
          "default": [
            "Performance",
            "Security",
            "Testing",
            "Documentation",
            "Error Handling",
            "Logging",
            "Code Complexity"
          ]
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

3. Pre-Commit Hook Script (bash):
```bash
#!/bin/bash

CHECKLIST_FILE=".code_review_checklist"

# Check if checklist is complete
if [ ! -f "$CHECKLIST_FILE" ]; then
  echo "Code review checklist not completed!"
  echo "Please fill out the checklist before committing:"
  cat << EOF
Code Review Checklist:
[ ] Performance considerations
[ ] Security review
[ ] Unit tests
[ ] Documentation
[ ] Error handling
[ ] Logging
[ ] Code complexity
EOF
  exit 1
fi
```

4. Slack/Teams Notification Integration:
```python
def send_code_review_reminder(pr_details):
    reminder_message = f"""
    🔍 Code Review Checklist for PR: {pr_details['title']}
    
    Checklist Items:
    ✅ Performance Analysis
    ✅ Security Vulnerability Check
    ✅ Unit Test Coverage
    ✅ Documentation Updates
    ✅ Error Handling Review
    ✅ Logging Implementation
    ✅ Code Complexity Evaluation
    
    Review Link: {pr_details['link']}
    """
    
    slack_client.chat_postMessage(
        channel='#code-reviews',
        text=reminder_message
    )
```

Recommended Implementation Strategy:
1. GitHub Action for PR checklist validation
2. VS Code extension for local development guidance
3. Pre-commit hook to enforce checklist completion
4. Slack/Teams integration for team-wide visibility

Additional Best Practices:
- Customize checklist based on your team's specific requirements
- Regularly review and update checklist items
- Provide clear guidelines for each checklist item
- Make checklist completion a collaborative, learning process

This multi-layered approach provides automated reminders, enforces best practices, and promotes code quality across your development workflow.
